segments.text: that was a great dinner . I didn't know that you knew how yo cook .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I'm glad you liked it . Are you ready for dessert ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I don't know . I'm pretty full . What are we having ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I made strawberry shortcake .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: ooh , that's my favorite . Maybe I'll have a small slice .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Great . Would you like coffee or tea with that ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I'll have a cup of tea .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: do you take cream or sugar with your tea ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: actually , could I have some milk with that ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: definitely . Would you like skim or whole milk ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: skim , please . That'd be very nice . Thanks ... oh no . Janna , I'm so sorry , but I've got to go .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: what happened ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I just got a message from my sister saying that she's been in a car accident . I need to go pick her up .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I'll go with you . Where is she ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: she's on the M40 , near Reading .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: is she alright ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I don't know , she didn't say . I'm so sorry about this .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: don't worry . Family comes first . Come on , let's go .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: actually , I've only got a two-seater . I'll have to go on my own .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: ok . Just call me if you need anything then .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I will . Thanks a lot .
segments.speaker: S1
